patterns.component_pattern: All UI components in src/components/ui/ are built on top of Material-UI (MUI) components with custom styling using styled() from @mui/material/styles
patterns.interactive_pattern: Interactive elements use cursor: pointer and hover effects (transform, boxShadow) when hoverable prop is true
patterns.props_pattern: Components use TypeScript interfaces for props, with optional onClick handlers typed as () => void
patterns.styling_pattern: Components use MUI's styled() API with theme-aware styling and SxProps for custom overrides

existing_implementations.description: Found Card component with base Card, KPICard, FeatureCard, and ProjectCard variants. All accept onClick handlers and use StyledCard with hoverable styling, but lack keyboard accessibility (no role, tabIndex, or keyboard handlers)
key_insights: StyledCard uses hoverable prop to enable cursor:pointer and hover transform effects
Button component wraps MUI Button which has built-in accessibility
No existing patterns for keyboard-accessible cards in the codebase
KPICard and ProjectCard are heavily used in DashboardPage and ProjectsPage
FeatureCard always sets hoverable=true regardless of onClick presence

accessibility_requirements.description: WCAG 2.1 Level A compliance requires role='button', tabIndex=0, and keyboard handlers for all clickable elements
wcag_criteria: 2.1.1 Keyboard - All functionality must be operable through keyboard
4.1.2 Name, Role, Value - Interactive elements must expose proper role to assistive technology

implementation_details.role: Add role='button' when onClick is provided
implementation_details.tabIndex: Add tabIndex=0 when onClick is provided to make element focusable
implementation_details.keyboard_handler: Add onKeyDown handler to trigger onClick on Enter/Space keys
implementation_details.cursor_style: cursor:pointer should only apply when onClick is provided
